resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new address given information

resources.name: Addresses
resources.description:
To add an address to your address book, you create a new address object. You can retrieve and delete individual
addresses as well as get a list of addresses. Addresses are identified by a unique random ID.

resources.name: Lob API 1.0.0
resources.description: The Lob API is organized around REST. Our API is designed to have predictable, resource-oriented URLs and uses HTTP response codes to indicate any API errors

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of your addresses. The addresses are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created addresses appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing address. You need only supply the unique identifier that was returned upon address creation.

RUN Address List first to obtain a valid address id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Delete
resources.description:
Deletes the details of an existing address. You need only supply the unique identifier that was returned upon address creation.

RUN Address List first to obtain a valid address id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new bank account with the provided properties.

resources.name: Bank Accounts
resources.description:
Bank Accounts allow you to store your bank account securely in our system. The API provides
endpoints for creating bank accounts, deleting bank accounts, verifying bank accounts,
retrieving individual bank accounts, and retrieving a list of bank accounts.

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of your bank accounts. The bank accounts are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created bank accounts appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing bank account. You need only supply the unique bank account identifier that was returned upon bank account creation.

**RUN Bank Account List first** to obtain a valid bank id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Verify
resources.description:
Verify a bank account in order to create a check.

RUN Bank Account List first to obtain a valid bank id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Delete
resources.description:
Permanently deletes a bank account. It cannot be undone.

RUN Bank Account List first to obtain a valid bank id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new check with the provided properties.

body.text:
{
  "description": "Demo Check",
  "to": {
    "description": "Harry - Office",
    "name": "Harry Zhang",
    "company": "Lob",
    "email": "harry@lob.com",
    "phone": "5555555555",
    "address_line1": "185 Berry St",
    "address_line2": "# 6100",
    "address_city": "San Francisco",
    "address_state": "CA",
    "address_zip": "94107",
    "address_country": "US"
  },
  "from": {
    "name": "Leore Avidar",
    "address_line1": "185 Berry St",
    "address_line2": "# 6100",
    "address_city": "San Francisco",
    "address_state": "CA",
    "address_zip": "94107-1741"
  },
  "bank_account": "{% response 'body', 'req_wrk_4ee6d1b8be2d44309dc09b3feda2041f91896a52', 'b64::JC5kYXRhWzBdLmlk::46b', 'never', 60 %}",
  "amount": 22.5,
  "memo": "rent",
  "logo": "https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/public.lob.com/assets/check_logo.png",
  "check_bottom": "{% response 'body', 'req_wrk_4ee6d1b8be2d44309dc09b3feda2041f8e14cc8e', 'b64::JC5kYXRhWzBdLmlk::46b', 'never', 60 %}",
  "merge_variables": {
    "name": "Harry"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "memo": "rafting trip"
  },
  "send_date": "2021-11-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "mail_type": "usps_first_class",
  "check_number": 10001
}

resources.name: Checks
resources.description:
Checks allow you to send payments via physical checks. The API provides endpoints
for creating checks, retrieving individual checks, canceling checks, and retrieving a list of checks.

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of your checks. The checks are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created checks appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing check. You need only supply the unique check identifier that was returned upon check creation.


**RUN Check List first** to obtain a valid check id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Cancel
resources.description:
Completely removes a check from production. This can only be done if the check has a send_date and the send_date has not yet passed. If the check is successfully canceled, you will not be charged for it. Read more on cancellation windows and scheduling. Scheduling and cancellation is a premium feature. Upgrade to the appropriate [Print & Mail Edition](https://dashboard.lob.com/#/login) to gain access.

**RUN Check List first** to obtain a valid check id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Verify
resources.description: Verify an international (except US or US territories) address with a live API key. Requests to this endpoint with a test API key will return a dummy response based on the primary line you input.

resources.name: Intl Verifications
resources.description: Address verification for non-US addresses

resources.name: Verify
resources.description: Verify a list of international (except US or US territories) address with a live API key. Requests to this endpoint with a test API key will return a dummy response based on the primary line you input.

resources.name: Intl Verifications Bulk
resources.description: Verify a list of non-US addresses.

resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new letter given information

body.text:
{
  "description": "demo",
  "to": {
    "description": "Harry - Office",
    "name": "Harry Zhang",
    "company": "Lob",
    "email": "harry@lob.com",
    "phone": "5555555555",
    "address_line1": "185 Berry St",
    "address_line2": "# 6100",
    "address_city": "San Francisco",
    "address_state": "CA",
    "address_zip": "94107",
    "address_country": "US"
  },
  "from": {
    "name": "Harry",
    "address_line1": "185 Berry St",
    "address_line2": "# 6100",
    "address_city": "San Francisco",
    "address_state": "CA",
    "address_zip": "94107"
  },
  "file": "<html style='padding-top: 3in; margin: .5in;'>HTML Letter for </html>",
  "color": true,
  "double_sided": false,
  "mail_type": "usps_first_class",
  "return_envelope": true,
  "perforated_page": 1,
  "merge_variables": {
    "name": "Harry"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "spiffy": "true"
  },
  "send_date": "2021-11-01T00:00:00.000Z",
  "extra_service": "registered",
  "custom_envelope": null
}

resources.name: Letters
resources.description:
The letters endpoint allows you to easily print and mail letters. The API provides endpoints for
creating letters, retrieving individual letters, canceling letters, and retrieving a list of letters.

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of your letters. The letters are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created letters appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing letter. You need only supply the unique letter identifier that was returned upon letter creation.

**RUN Letter List first** to obtain a valid letter id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Cancel
resources.description:
Completely removes a letter from production. This can only be done if the letter has a send_date and the send_date has not yet passed. If the letter is successfully canceled, you will not be charged for it. Read more on cancellation windows and scheduling. Scheduling and cancellation is a premium feature. Upgrade to the appropriate Print & Mail Edition to gain access.

**RUN Letter List first** to obtain a valid letter id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new postcard given information

body.text:
{
  "description": "demo",
  "to": {
    "description": "Harry - Office",
    "name": "Harry Zhang",
    "company": "Lob",
    "email": "harry@lob.com",
    "phone": "5555555555",
    "address_line1": "185 Berry St",
    "address_line2": "# 6100",
    "address_city": "San Francisco",
    "address_state": "CA",
    "address_zip": "94107",
    "address_country": "US"
  },
  "from": {
    "description": "Harry - Office",
    "name": "Harry Zhang",
    "company": "Lob",
    "email": "harry@lob.com",
    "phone": "5555555555",
    "address_line1": "185 Berry St",
    "address_line2": "# 6100",
    "address_city": "San Francisco",
    "address_state": "CA",
    "address_zip": "94107",
    "address_country": "US"
  },
  "front": "{% response 'body', 'req_wrk_4ee6d1b8be2d44309dc09b3feda2041f8e14cc8e', 'b64::JC5kYXRhWzBdLmlk::46b', 'never', 60 %}",
  "back": "{% response 'body', 'req_wrk_4ee6d1b8be2d44309dc09b3feda2041f8e14cc8e', 'b64::JC5kYXRhWzBdLmlk::46b', 'never', 60 %}",
  "size": "6x9",
  "mail_type": "usps_first_class",
  "merge_variables": {
    "name": "Harry"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "spiffy": "true"
  },
  "send_date": "2021-11-01T00:00:00.000Z"
}

resources.name: Postcards
resources.description:
The postcards endpoint allows you to easily print and mail postcards. The API provides endpoints for creating postcards,
retrieving individual postcards, canceling postcards, and retrieving a list of postcards.

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of your postcards. The addresses are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created addresses appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing postcard. You need only supply the unique customer identifier that was returned upon postcard creation.


**RUN Postcard List first** to obtain a valid postcard id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Cancel
resources.description:
Completely removes a postcard from production. This can only be done if the postcard has a send_date and the send_date has not yet passed. If the postcard is successfully canceled, you will not be charged for it. Read more on cancellation windows and scheduling. Scheduling and cancellation is a premium feature. Upgrade to the appropriate Print & Mail Edition to gain access.

**RUN Postcard List first** to obtain a valid postcard id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new self_mailer given information

resources.name: Self Mailers
resources.description:
The self mailer endpoint allows you to easily print and mail self mailers. The API provides endpoints
for creating self mailers, retrieving individual self mailers, canceling self mailers, and retrieving a list of self mailers.

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of your self_mailers. The self_mailers are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created self_mailers appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing self_mailer. You need only supply the unique self_mailer identifier that was returned upon self_mailer creation.

**RUN Self Mailer List first** to obtain a valid self-mailer id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Delete
resources.description:
Completely removes a self mailer from production. This can only be done if the self mailer's send_date has not yet passed. If the self mailer is successfully canceled, you will not be charged for it. This feature is exclusive to certain customers. Upgrade to the appropriate Print & Mail Edition to gain access.

**RUN Self Mailer List first** to obtain a valid self-mailer id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new template given information

resources.name: Templates
resources.description: These API endpoints allow you to create, retrieve, update and delete reusable HTML templates for use with the print & mail API.

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of your templates. The templates are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recently created templates appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing template. You need only supply the unique template identifier that was returned upon template creation.


**RUN Template List first** to obtain a valid template id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Compile
resources.description:
Compiles a template with passed in merge variables into html.

**RUN Template List first** to obtain a valid template id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Update
resources.description:
Updates the description and/or published version of the template with the given id. To update the template's html, create a new version of the template.

**RUN Template List first** to obtain a valid template id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Delete
resources.description:
Deletes the details of an existing template. You need only supply the unique template identifier that was returned upon template creation.

**RUN Template List first** to obtain a valid template id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Create
resources.description: Creates a new template version attached to the specified template.

resources.name: Template Versions
resources.description: These API endpoints allow you to create, retrieve, update and delete versions of reusable HTML templates for use with the print & mail API.

resources.name: List
resources.description: Returns a list of template versions for the passed template_id. The template versions are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created appearing first.

resources.name: Retrieve
resources.description:
Retrieves the template version with the given template and version ids.

**RUN Template List & Template Version List first** to obtain a valid template & version id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Update
resources.description:
Updates the template version with the given template and version ids.

**RUN Template List & Template Version List first** to obtain a valid template & version id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Delete
resources.description:
Permanently deletes a template version. A template's published_version can not be deleted.

**RUN Template List & Template Version List first** to obtain a valid template & version id for use with this operation.

resources.name: Autocomplete
resources.description: Given an address prefix consisting of a partial primary line, as well as optional input of city, state, and zip code, this functionality returns up to 10 full US address suggestions. Not all of them will turn out to be valid addresses.

resources.name: US Autocompletions
resources.description: Given partial address information, this endpoint returns up to 10 address suggestions.

resources.name: Verify
resources.description: Verify a US or US territory address with a live API key. The address can be in components (e.g. primary_line is "185 Berry Street", zip_code is "94107") or as a single string (e.g. "185 Berry Street 94107"), but not as both. Requests using a test API key validate required fields but return empty values unless specific primary_line values are provided.

resources.name: US Verifications
resources.description: Validate, automatically correct, and standardize the addresses in your address book based on USPS's [Coding Accuracy Support System (CASS)](https://postalpro.usps.com/certifications/cass).

resources.name: Verify
resources.description: Verify a list of US or US territory addresses with a live API key. Requests to this endpoint with a test API key will return a dummy response based on the primary line you input.

resources.name: US Verifications Bulk
resources.description: Verify a list of US addresses.

resources.name: Looksup
resources.description: Returns information about a ZIP code

resources.name: Zip Lookups
resources.description: Find a list of cities, states and associated information about a US ZIP code.
